headline: 'He changed in a very insidious way': Parents' distress at sons embracing toxic masculinity
description: The rise of masculinist rhetoric among young people is creating new tensions within families. Mothers and sisters are often targeted by boys who have been radicalized online. Fathers are left feeling helpless.

headline: EU-Mercosur trade deal set to take effect without waiting for European Parliament vote
Mediator Oman hails 'breakthrough' in US-Iran nuclear talks
French court upholds 'far left' label for Mélenchon's LFI
description: The Council of State rejected the appeal filed by Jean-Luc Mélenchon's La France Insoumise against the Interior Ministry's decision to remove its candidates from the 'left bloc' for the upcoming municipal elections.

headline: Paramount acquires Warner Bros. in $110 billion deal, creating Hollywood behemoth
description: The final deal caps a five-month bidding battle with Netflix, and will give birth to one of the most powerful entertainment conglomerates in the world.

headline: Could Punch the monkey make us a little more human?
description: Social media users around the world are captivated by the plight of a baby monkey abandoned by its mother and taken in by a Japanese zoo. The story reveals how our tendency toward anthropomorphism can spark a rare, collective empathy.

headline: 'The Louvre director's resignation raises an old question: Why do cultural execs go mad?'
description: Laurence des Cars, who handed her resignation from the Paris museum on February 24, joined a list of cultural executives accused of being overzealous. The French government is not without responsibility, analyzes Le Monde columnist Michel Guerrin.

headline: Risk of open war between Afghanistan and Pakistan appears contained for now
Trump suggests a 'friendly takeover' of Cuba
Sweden confirms that drone near French aircraft carrier was Russian
EU-Mercosur agreement: Five key questions about where things stand
Starmer weakened as Green Party wins in Labour stronghold near Manchester
Germany orders global recall of BMW
Mélenchon, in Lyon, defends allies accused of participating in fatal beating
Former Elysée Palace steward on trial for stealing precious porcelain
Bill Clinton says he 'did nothing wrong' with Epstein during Congressional panel
With an estimated 500,000 killed, the Russia-Ukraine war is Europe's deadliest since 1945
Tram crash in Milan kills two people and injures 39 others
Pakistan and Afghanistan escalate conflict, with unpredictable consequences
How Paris is turning into 'Frollywood,' a refuge for American actors
description: Whether George Clooney, Matt Dillon or Kristen Stewart, France is attracting more and more actors from across the Atlantic. This trend speaks to both the Trump-era crisis and the decline of the Hollywood model.

headline: Ukraine: 'The war could still last for years and paradoxically, time is not on the Kremlin's side'
description: Researcher Dimitri Minic tells Le Monde in an interview that it is 'too soon to write off Ukraine,' even though the balance of power currently favors Russia.

headline: The Langs' troubling friendship with Jeffrey Epstein
description: Former French culture minister Jack Lang and his daughter Caroline Lang appear thousands of times in the most recently released documents. All evidence suggests that she had a much closer relationship with the sex offender than she now admits.

headline: 'The Epstein scandal is astonishing by the scale of the complicity and rape culture at the top of society'
'Trump is the president of instability and uncertainty, increasingly to his own detriment'
'The US Supreme Court tariff decision helps dispel the image of an institution that has become entirely subservient to the president'
